articles.title: One of Earth’s most abundant lifeforms has a fatal flaw
articles.description: SAR11 bacteria dominate the world’s oceans by being incredibly efficient, shedding genes to survive in nutrient-poor waters. But that extreme streamlining appears to backfire when conditions change. Under stress, many cells keep copying their DNA without dividing, creating abnormal cells that grow l

articles.title: Risks of working with China outweigh the benefits, Michael Kovrig warns
articles.description: Carney may be reacting from an 'aversion to Trumpian chaos on one side,' and 'affinity for the technocratic order of the Chinese Communist Party on the other'

articles.title: Conservancy to safeguard 91 hectares of rural Ottawa wetlands
articles.description: The land is part of the Marlborough Wetland system, located within the Marlborough Forest in southwest Ottawa.

articles.title: Is it legal for the government to implement cuts before the budget becomes law?
articles.description: A former public service executive says the workforce adjustment process underway is "both legal and necessary."

articles.title: Groundhog Day 2026: Willie in Ontario, Fred in Quebec predict early spring
articles.description: Canada’s famous prognosticating rodents are predicting an early spring. Wiarton Willie, in Bruce County, Ont., and Fred la Marmotte, the famous groundhog in Quebec’s Gaspesie region, reportedly did not see their shadows this morning, which is good news for people tired of wintry weather.

articles.title: What to expect as businessman Frank Stronach stands trial on sexual assault charges
articles.description: TORONTO — The man long touted as one of Canada’s great success stories is set to stand trial in Toronto this week, as the first of two cases accusing Frank Stronach of sexual offences against several women over decades begins.
